content.prompt: Free-trade zones such as the countries of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) are established to increase the ease and volume of international trade by

choices.label: opening borders to migrant guest workers from member states
establishing a common monetary unit among member states
offering large economic-development loans to poorer member states
eliminating tariffs on goods that cross borders between member states

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain spatial relationships in a specified context or region of the world, using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
